Package cycle

Class Cycle

  • java.lang.Object
    • cycle.Cycle
  • public class Cycle
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a cycle in the graph with its associated weight. The cycle is represented as a linked list of nodes.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Cycle()
      Constructs a new Cycle object with the nest node and initializes the weight to 0.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addNode​(int nod)
      Adds a new node to the cycle.
      int getCurrentCycleWeight()
      Retrieves the current weight of the cycle.
      java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Integer> getCycleList()
      Returns an unmodifiable view of the cycle.
      int getLastNode()
      Returns the last node in the cycle.
      void incrementCurrentCycleWeight​(int increment)
      Increments the current cycle weight by a given amount.
      boolean isLastNode​(java.lang.Integer element)
      Checks if the provided node is the last one in the cycle.
      void layP​(EventManager PEC)
      This method lays the pheromone in the cycle based on the current cycle weight.
      void printElements()
      This method prints all elements of the cycle.
      void removeCycle​(int stopNod, java.util.BitSet nVNodes)
      Removes nodes from the cycle up to a given stop node, and updates the current cycle weight accordingly.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Cycle

        public Cycle()
        Constructs a new Cycle object with the nest node and initializes the weight to 0.

    • Method Detail

      • getCycleList

        public java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Integer> getCycleList()
        Returns an unmodifiable view of the cycle.
        Returns:
        Unmodifiable list representing the cycle.

      • addNode

        public void addNode​(int nod)
        Adds a new node to the cycle.
        Parameters:
        nod - the node to be added to the cycle.

      • getLastNode

        public int getLastNode()
        Returns the last node in the cycle. If the cycle is empty, returns -1.
        Returns:
        the last node in the cycle or -1 if the cycle is empty.

      • isLastNode

        public boolean isLastNode​(java.lang.Integer element)
        Checks if the provided node is the last one in the cycle.
        Parameters:
        element - Node to check.
        Returns:
        true if the provided node is the last one, false otherwise.

      • getCurrentCycleWeight

        public int getCurrentCycleWeight()
        Retrieves the current weight of the cycle.
        Returns:
        Current weight of the cycle.

      • incrementCurrentCycleWeight

        public void incrementCurrentCycleWeight​(int increment)
        Increments the current cycle weight by a given amount.
        Parameters:
        increment - Amount to increment the cycle weight by.

      • removeCycle

        public void removeCycle​(int stopNod,
                        java.util.BitSet nVNodes)
        Removes nodes from the cycle up to a given stop node, and updates the current cycle weight accordingly.
        Parameters:
        stopNod - Node at which to stop removing nodes.
        nVNodes - BitSet representing nodes in the cycle.

      • layP

        public void layP​(EventManager PEC)
        This method lays the pheromone in the cycle based on the current cycle weight. This method also takes care of scheduling a pheromone evaporation event.
        Parameters:
        PEC - EventManager object that manages the events.

      • printElements

        public void printElements()
        This method prints all elements of the cycle. It prints the elements as a comma separated string surrounded by braces.
